Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Editorial Co-Manager (with Giovanni Piccirilli) of the Working Paper Series of the School of Government, LUISS Guido Carli.
Member of the Editorial Committee of the Working Paper Series of the Department of Political Science, LUISS University Press, LUISS Guido Carli.

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: ECPR General Conference; Presentation of the paper: Fioramonti L. and Poletti A., ‘The External Image of the EU: Brazil, India and South Africa’, Pisa.

XXII Annual Convention of Italian Political Science Association; Presentation of the paper: Poletti A. ‘The logic of protection through multilateralism: the EU and agricultural trade negotiations in the Doha round', Pavia.

Autumn Seminar of the European Foreign Security Policy Studies Programme ‘ST. Malo 10 Years On: Taking stock of the EU as an International Player; Presentation of the paper: Poletti A. ‘Trade as an instrument of structural foreign policy: the EU in international trade negotiations’, Brussels.
ECPR Joint Sessions, Workshop "The EU in the World Economy"; Presentation of the paper: Poletti A. ‘The EU, judicialization and trade liberalization: why too much caution is not needed’, Lisbon.

XXIII Annual Convention of the Italian Political Science Association; Presentation of the paper: Poletti A. ‘Cooperating in the shadow of the law: judicialization and the expansion of WTO reach’, Rome.

ECPR Joint Sessions, Workshop "Between Facts and Norms? International Legalization Research and International Political Theory"; Presentation of the paper: De Bièvre D. and Poletti A. ‘Cooperation in the Shadow of WTO law: judicialization and the legalization of international trade, Münster.

GARNET Conference "The European Union in International Affairs"; Presentation of the paper: Poletti A. ‘Accounting for variation in the politics of trade preferences formation: the European Union in the Doha Round’, Brussels.

Workshop on International Relations (WIRE) on "Issue linkages and regime complexes", Univrsité Libre de Bruxelles (ULB); Presentation of the paper: De Bièvre and Poletti A. ‘Cooperating under the shadow of WTO law: how legal vulnerability encourages issue linkage’, Brussels.
Guest Lecture at the School of International Studies of the University of Trento (Italy). Title - Judicializaition and Cooperation in the WTO: Why too Much Caution is Not Needed.

Workshop ‘Diverging Paradigms on EU trade policy’, KU Leuven; Presentation of the paper: Poletti A. ’Making sense of multiple and shifting trade politics: the European Union in the Doha round’, Leuven.

EUSA 12th Biennial International Conference; Presentation of the paper: Poletti A. and Sicurelli D. ‘Searching for immunity under the shadow of WTO law: Explaining EU Preferences on Trade-and-Environment in the Doha Development Agenda’, Boston.

Kick-Off Workshop ‘The cause, consequences and democratic legitimacy of international institutions’ of the Research Program Global Democratic Governance, University of St. Gallen; Presentation of the paper: De Bièvre D. and Poletti A. ‘Cooperation in the shadow of WTO law: why litigate when you can negotiate’, St. Gallen.
XXV Annual Meeting of the Italian Political Science Association, Presentation of hte paper: Poletti A. ‘The domestic determinants of defendants’ responses in WTO litigation’, Palermo.

ECPR Joint Sessions, Workshop "The transformation of international trade governance’; Presentation of the paper: Poletti A. and De Bièvre D., ‘Why harmonize regulation in regional rather than multilateral trade settings’, Antwerp.

XXVI Annual Meeting of the Italian Political Science Association; Moschella M. and Poletti. A., Organization of the Panel ‘Governing political-economic changes in times of crisis: the EU under stress’, Rome.

ECPR Joint Sessions, Workshop "The Design and Effects of International Institutions"; Presentation of the paper: Bièvre D., Poletti A. Hanegraaff M. and Beyers J. ‘International institutions and domestic coalitions: judicialization, negotiations, and collective action in trade policy', Mainz.
ECPR General Conference; Presentation of the paper: De Bièvre D. and Poletti A., ‘To enforce or not to enforce? WTO judicialization, forum shopping and global regulatory harmonization’, Bordeaux.

ECPR Joint Sessions, Workshop "Political Organisation in Transformation? The Impact of State Regulation on Parties, Interest Groups and NGOs in Advanced Democracies", Presentation of the paper: Hanegraaff M., Poletti A. and Beyers J., ‘Explaining lobbying styles across the Atlantic: an empirical assessment of the cultural and institutional hypotheses’, Salamanca
Organization of Workshop ‘Judicial politics in international trade relations’ (with Dirk De Bièvre), in preparation of a Special Issue of the World Trade Review, Antwerp,

Annual Conference of the Standing Group of International Relations, Fondazione Bruno Kessler (FBK), Presentation of the paper: Eckhardt J. and Poletti A., 'Trading with the East: Import-Dependent Firms and EU’s Preferential Trade Agreements with Asian Partners', Trento

Guest lecture at the GEM-PhD Summer School ‘Competing for Growth, Trade and Influence’, ULB Brussels. Title: Trading with Asia: Global Value Chains, Import-Dependent Firms, and the EU Strategy of Competitive Trade Liberalization in the Asian Region.

Conference "Risks and opportunities in the civil society-public institutions relationship", LUISS Guido Carli; Presentation of the paper: Hanegraaff M and Poletti A., ‘How global is global governance’, Rome.

Refract Kick-Off Meeting, Institute for European Studies, Vrij Universiteit Brussel (VUB), Presentation of the concept paper: De Bièvre and Poletti A., 'A concept paper on comparing actual and potential WTO', Brussels. disputes on energy subsidies”

Conference "Governance and Integration Through Free Trade Agreements", Presentation of the paper: Eckhardt J. and Poletti A., ‘Trading with Asia: import-dependent firms and the signing of EU-Asia Trade Agreements’, London.

World Trade Forum; Presentation of the paper: De Bièvre D., Yildirim A. and Poletti A. ‘About the melting of icebergs: discovering the political economic determinants of dispute initiation and resolution in the WTO’, Bern.

Concluding remarks at the conference "The European Union and the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership: Managing Globalization?", jointly organized by LUISS School of Government, Istituto Affari Internationali and German Marshall Fund, Rome.

9th Annual Conference Political Economy of International Organizations (PEIO); Presentation of the paper: Yildirim A., Poletti A. and Chatagnier T., ‘ Political Economy of the WTO Dispute Settlement: The EU and the US‘ Commitment to Trade Liberalization and the Impact of Global Value Chains’, Salt Lake City.

International Conference "Global Commons, Global Public Goods and Global Democracy" , Leuven Centre for Global Governance Studies; Presentation of the paper: De Bièvre D., Espa I. and Poletti A., ‘On the Legal,Political, and Economic Origins of Actual and Potential WTO Disputes on Subsidies for Fossil and Renewable Energy Sources’, Leuven.

Flemish-Dutch Annual Political Science Conference; Presentation of the paper: De Bièvre D. and Poletti A., ‘Why the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership is not (so) new, and why it is also not (so) bad’, Brussels, 3 June.

European Political Science Association Conference; Presentation of the paper: Yildirim A., Chatagnier T. and Poletti A. ‘The internationalization of production and the politics of compliance in WTO disputes’, Brussels.
XXX Annual Convention of the Italian Political Science Association; Presentation of the paper: Poletti A., 'Containment through trade: the politics of US trade agreements', Milan.

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Bi-Annual Research Project: "Trade and aid as instruments of European structural foreign policy: assessing the impact of identity on European foreing policy". Awarded by Fondazione Compagnia di San Paolo, the Riksbankens Jubileumsfond and the VolkswagenStiftung in the context of the jointly developed programme "European Foreign and Security Policy Studies".

UA Post-Doctoral Research Fellowship for International Scientific Mobility (principal investigator); Awarded by the Scientific Council of the University of Antwerp. Research project title: Cooperating in the shadow of the law: judicialization and the expansion of WTO reach

FWO Post-doctoral Fellowship (principal investigator); awarded by the Flemish Research Foundation. Research project title: Investigating how latent and actual WTO dispute can remove barriers to trade.
Research Fellowship; Department of Sociology and Social Research - University of Trento
Junior Researcher (Ricercatore a tempo determinato, ex art. 24, co. 3 lett. A, L. 240/2010); Department of Political Science - LUISS Guido Carli.

Research paper on "Global Value Chains and WTO Dispute Settlement", commissioned by the Research Project on International Politics and Conflict Resolution (CERPIC) - Fondazione Bruno Kessler

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: Member of the Academic Board of the Doctorate of Research currently denominated "Doctoral Program in Politics: History, Theory, Science", Department of Political Science, LUISS Guido Carli.
Member of the Doctoral Committee of Mr. Aydin Yildirim (PhD Candidate in International Political Economy), Department of Political and Social Sciences, University of Antwerp.
Titularity of the course "Public Policies: Frameworks and Theories", Doctoral Program in Politics: History, Theory, Science", Department of Political Science, LUISS Guido Carli.
Titularity of the course "Public Policies: Frameworks and Theories", Doctoral Program in Politics: History, Theory, Science", Department of Political Science, LUISS Guido Carli.
Titularity of the course "Public Policies: Frameworks and Theories", Doctoral Program in Politics: History, Theory, Science", Department of Political Science, LUISS Guido Carli.

Co-supervision (with Louis Bélanger - Universitè Laval, and Ettore Greco - Istituto Affari Internazionali) of the doctoral research project "The Institutions of European External Action and Institutional Proliferation within the Global Trade System" in the context of the European Joint Doctorate on Globalization, Europe and Multilateralism, Sophistication of the Transnational Order, Networks and European Strategies" (GEM-STONES – Horizon 2020).

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Guest Professorship; Master of Science in Comparative European Politics, University of Antwerp. Course title: ‘Issues in comparative politics’.
Postdoctoral Fellowship; Awarded by the Flemish Research Foundation (FWO) and carried out at the University of Antwerp
Co-titularity (with Dirk De Bièvre) of the course ‘International Political Economy’; Master of Science in Comparative European Politics, University of Antwerp.
Visiting Fellowship at the China Foreing Affairs Institute (CFAU) in Beijing; Awarded in the context of the LUISS International Chairs 2015 – Academic Exchange Programme.

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Co-Director of the MA/LLM "Law and Government of the European Union" (MLAG); School of Government - LUISS Guido Carli

(Normative issues) of the Network of Excellence Global Governance, Regionalisation and Regulation: the Role of the EU – GARNET (Contract No 513330); (EU 6th Framework Programme 2005-2010; Call Identifier: FP6-2002-Citizens-3 –
Member of the Steering Committee of the School of Government - LUISS Guido Carli

Participation to the international collaborative project "European Joint Doctorate on Globalization, Europe and Multilateralism, Sophistication of the Transnational Order, Networks and European Strategies" (GEM-STONES – Horizon 2020; Marie Sklodowska Curie Action - European Joint Doctorate - MSCA-EJD). Partner institutions: University of Warwick, Universiteit Hamburg, Universitè Libre de Brussel, LUISS Guido Carli, the Transatantic Foundation. Project title: The Institutions of European External Action and Institutional Proliferation within the Global Trade System.

Participation to the collaborative reserch project "Political Affairs and Technological Transformation: Evolution and Relevance for NATO Strategy" (PATTERN), sponsored by the NATO Supreme Allied Commander Transformation and jointly executed by the Alma Mater University of Bologna and the Bruno Kessler Foundation.

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: UA Post-Doctoral Research Fellowship for International Scientific Mobility (principal investigator); Awarded by the Scientific Council of the University of Antwerp. Research project title: Cooperating in the shadow of the law: judicialization and the expansion of WTO reach

NCCR Post-Doctoral Fellowship (principal investigator) (offer declined); awarded by the World Trade Institute of the University of Bern and the the Swiss Government. Research project title: Domestic Responses in the Shadow of WTO law: the Politics of WTO Dispute Settlement in the EU and the US.

FWO Post-doctoral Fellowship (principal investigator); awarded by the Flemish Research Foundation. Research project title: Investigating how latent and actual WTO dispute can remove barriers to trade.
